meanings.definition: The action of bringing someone or something under domination or control.
meanings.sent1: The subjugation of the wild horse was accomplished through gentle training methods.
meanings.sent2: The country's subjugation by a foreign power led to years of oppression.
meanings.sent3: The subjugation of the mischievous puppy involved lots of treats and belly rubs.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was a heavy subjugation weighing down her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The subjugation of the dragon was a tale passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: The state of being under the control or authority of another.
meanings.sent1: After the war, the subjugation of the defeated nation was evident in their loss of independence.
meanings.sent2: The villagers lived in constant fear of the subjugation by the ruthless warlord.
meanings.sent3: The subjugation of the remote island by a group of penguins was quite a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The subjugation of the sun by the clouds cast a shadow over the entire valley.
meanings.sent5: The subjugation of the mind by negative thoughts can be a difficult battle to overcome.
